title: Andrew Tate: See luxury villa where brothers are under house arrest
description: The BBC's Lucy Williamson looks at the compound where Andrew Tate and brother Tristan are confined.

title: Fentanyl - a killer drug’s trail of destruction
description: Americans are dying from fentanyl overdoses at an alarming rate. But the tragic story begins further south.

title: Anger and anxiety - inside pro-Trump online networks
description: Donald Trump called on his supporters to protest about his indictment - so how are they responding?

title: Manchester City say Liverpool bus attacked on journey from Etihad Stadium
description: Manchester City strongly condemn the actions of those responsible for damage to the Liverpool team coach.

title: Chelsea 0-2 Aston Villa: Unai Emery's side earn composed win
description: Aston Villa manager Unai Emery masterminds another victory away from home with a composed display against Chelsea to put pressure back on Graham Potter.

title: Extra night ferries laid on to clear Dover backlog
description: The additional services will run overnight as the port's operations team works through the Easter backlog.

title: Women's Six Nations 2023: Scotland 22-34 Wales - visitors break Scottish hearts again
description: Wales once again broke Scottish hearts after edging a breathless Edinburgh encounter.

title: Ken Buchanan 1945-2023: 'One of Scotland's greatest in any age & any sport'
description: Ken Buchanan was of Leith and Edinburgh but he was one of the most accomplished fighters the cruellest sport has ever known, writes Tom English.

title: Lufthansa glitch sees airline sell man's return ticket
description: Ieuan Davies had to spend £932 on alternative flight after being told he was not on outbound flight.

title: Women's Six Nations 2023: Injury-hit England unlikely to stumble against Italy
description: England are missing 19 players but are overwhelming favourites to beat Italy in the Women's Six Nations on Sunday.

title: Two Iranian women arrested for not covering hair after man attacks them with yoghurt
description: The women seem to have been attacked for not wearing the hijab properly in public, which is illegal.

title: Crystal Palace 2-1 Leicester City: Jean-Philippe Mateta snatches late victory over Foxes
description: Jean-Philippe Mateta snatches a late victory as Crystal Palace win in the Premier League for the first time in 2023.

title: Arsenal 4-1 Leeds United: Gabriel Jesus scores twice as Gunners restore eight-point lead
description: Gabriel Jesus scores his first Arsenal goals since October as the Gunners restore their eight-point lead at the top of the Premier League with a comfortable win over Leeds.

title: Man City 4-1 Liverpool: 'Gap between two sides resembles a chasm'
description: BBC Sport's chief football Phil McNulty reflects on Man City's 4-1 hammering of Liverpool in Premier League

title: Laura Kuenssberg: Should we shut down AI?
description: Should we worry about artificial intelligence, or embrace the possibilities it brings, asks Laura Kuenssberg.

title: Manchester City 4-1 Liverpool: Pep Guardiola's side overcome Erling Haaland's absence to sink Reds
description: Manchester City overcome the absence of leading scorer Erling Haaland to hammer Liverpool and cut Arsenal's lead at the top to five points.

title: Nottingham: 'White collar' boxer injured in charity bout dies
description: The amateur fighter was taken to hospital after his bout but his condition deteriorated.

title: Paul O'Grady: Donations since his death overwhelms Battersea Cats and Dog Home
description: Battersea Cats and Dogs Home receives more than £100,000 after the presenter's death.

title: Ken Buchanan: Scottish boxing great dies at 77
description: Ken Buchanan, Scotland's first undisputed world champion and arguably the country's greatest boxer, dies at the age of 77.

title: Brighton & Hove Albion Women 0-4 Manchester United Women: Leah Galton nets double for WSL leaders
description: Leah Galton's double sees Manchester United extend their lead at the top of the WSL with a ruthless win at Brighton.

title: Iran signals determination to enforce hijab rules
description: After months of protests, authorities make clear their enforcement of hijab rules on women.

title: Tottenham Hotspur: Where do club go after Antonio Conte sacking?
description: Football Focus panel Glenn Whelan, Stephen Warnock and The Athletic's journalist Charlie Eccleshare discuss where the club go now after sacking manager Antonio Conte.

title: Shelly-Ann Fraser-Pryce: Olympic champion runs in son's sports day
description: Triple Olympic champion Shelly-Ann Fraser-Pryce runs in her son's school sports day parents' race - with predictable results.

title: Australian Grand Prix: Realistic Mercedes will still 'go for it'
description: George Russell was torn between realism and ambition after securing Mercedes' first front-row qualifying result of the season at the Australian Grand Prix.

title: 'I'm still alive' jokes Pope as he leaves hospital
description: He was admitted to Gemelli Hospital in Rome on Wednesday with breathing difficulties.

title: Russia assumes UN Security Council presidency despite Ukrainian anger
description: Ukraine's foreign minister said Russia leading the UN Security Council is "the worst joke ever".

title: Cambridgeshire shootings: Man, 66, due in court charged with murders
description: Stephen Alderton, 66, is charged over the deaths of Gary and Josh Dunmore in Cambridgeshire.

title: Watch: Four times US tornadoes were caught on camera
description: Amateurs as well as TV crews filmed the tornadoes sweeping across several states.

title: Football kit redesigns highlight climate change
description: Clubs to have their logos rejigged include Manchester City, Chelsea, West Ham, Forest, Ipswich and Norwich.

title: Formula 1: Max Verstappen on Australian Grand Prix pole ahead of George Russell
description: Red Bull's Max Verstappen takes pole position for the Australian Grand Prix ahead of the Mercedes of George Russell and Lewis Hamilton.

title: IPL 2023: How should Sam Curran handle pressure of being most expensive signing?
description: England all-rounder Sam Curran is now the most expensive player in Indian Premier League history, but how did previous holder Chris Morris deal with the pressure?

title: Anthony Joshua v Jermaine Franklin: Predictions from pros and pundits for heavyweight fight
description: Before Anthony Joshua takes on American heavyweight Jermaine Franklin at the O2 Arena in London on Saturday, BBC Sport rounds up predictions from the boxing world.

title: Miami Open 2023 results: Jannik Sinner stuns Carlos Alcaraz to face Daniil Medvedev in final
description: Jannik Sinner comes from a set down to claim a shock win over top seed Carlos Alcaraz in the Miami Open semi-finals.

title: Bellator 293: Leah McCourt loses points decision to Cat Zingano
description: Cat Zingano beats Leah McCourt in a close-fought battle at Bellator 293 to retain her number one contender spot in the featherweight division.

title: Bellator 293: Luke Trainer secures shock win and proposes to girlfriend in cage
description: British MMA fighter Luke Trainer proposes to his girlfriend at Bellator 293 after defeating Sullivan Cauley by submission.

title: The ferry in the Netherlands hosting refugees and migrants
description: The Dutch government is hosting 900 migrants and asylum seekers on the Silja Europa passenger ship.

title: Deadly US tornadoes: Theatre roof destroyed during heavy metal gig
description: Five are in critical condition at an Illinois theatre as lethal tornados sweep several US states.

title: Iowa tornadoes captured by eyewitness in car
description: Footage shows the tornadoes sweeping through Iowa - one of several states facing power outages.

title: Unlimited fines for water companies dumping sewage
description: Ministers want to "make polluters pay", after more than 300,000 waste spills in England's waterways last year.

title: Trump indictment: 'I worry for the times ahead'
description: US voters tell the BBC how they feel about the historic indictment of a former US president.

title: West Burton A - the past and the future of power?
description: One of the last UK coal-fired power stations has closed and could make way for a fusion reactor.

title: Oldham Coliseum: Historic theatre stages final act after funding cut
description: The final curtain falls on the Oldham Coliseum after it had its Arts Council England funding removed.

title: Trump and Stormy Daniels cash in on merchandise after indictment
description: The adult film star pops the champagne as she says orders for T-shirts and other gear are "pouring in".

title: The Papers: Biden to ‘miss’ coronation and Sunak on trade deal
description: The US leader will decline an invite to see King Charles crowned next month, The Telegraph reports.

title: Lazarus Heist: The intercontinental ATM theft that netted $14m in two hours
description: How criminals seemingly working for North Korea were able to plunder cashpoints in 28 countries.
